content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

In the country of Alpha, <math alttext="T"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>T</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>-shirts are sold domestically in a competitive market, the equilibrium price is $10, and the equilibrium quantity is 100.

(a) Draw a correctly labeled demand and supply graph for the domestic <math alttext="T"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-shirt market in Alpha. Plot the numbers on the graph.

(b) Assume the world price of <math alttext="T"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-shirts is $6, and Alpha engages in international trade.

(i) Will Alpha be an exporter or importer of <math alttext="T"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-shirts? Explain.

(ii) On your graph in part (a), indicate the domestic quantity demanded of <math alttext="T"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-shirts at the world price and label it <math alttext="Q sub D"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(iii) On your graph in part (a), indicate the change in the consumer surplus, shaded completely.

(c) Suppose the government of Alpha imposes a tariff of $2 on <math alttext="T"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-shirts. On your graph in part (a), indicate the new domestic quantity supplied of <math alttext="T"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-shirts as a result of the tariff and label it <math alttext="Q sub S"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
